intro: Beckera mutica, commonly known as the rough Beckera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Beckera mutica is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
